newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan's TEPCO to stop nuclear plant for checks.
newsitem.headline: Japan's TEPCO to stop nuclear plant for checks.

text.p: A second Japanese nuclear complex was shut on Thursday when Tokyo Electric Power Co Inc -- TEPCO -- announced it had halted operations at the plant to check an irregularity in the reactor container.

In a statement two days after an accident at a nuclear processing plant in Tokaimura, 160 km (100 miles) northeast of Tokyo, TEPCO said it decided to manually stop operations at the 1.1 million kilowatt boiling water reactor in Niigata Prefecture in northern Japan.
The statement said the shutdown was because a valve in the reactor container was found to malfunction during routine maintenance.
The plant, which has been undergoing routine maintenance checks since December, was due to start up in mid-March.
The reactor's operations have gradually been slowed and will completely stop on Friday, the statement said.
The company said there was no damage to the environment from the incident.
In the Tokai incident on Tuesday, 37 workers were exposed to mild radiation during a fire and explosion.
